name: 自由寫作
goals: Writing four short, and one long, essays/stories in English
Reading and appreciating classic works of nonfiction writing in English
Thinking critically and artistically about Taiwan and their hometown/neighborhood
syllabus:
**Monday**: 10:20a.m. to 12:10 p.m.; 正106

Professor Meyer

Email: mmeyer@pitt.edu

Office hours: Tuesday: 10am-12pm, and by appointment

methodologies.note: For every class meeting, there is a reading assignment equal to two book chapters. I will introduce each writer and the context of their essay/story. We will spend the first half of each class closely analyzing the author’s storytelling.
We will spend the first half of each class closely analyzing the author’s storytelling. Everyone is expected to contribute to discussion.
In the second half of each class, we will apply a craft technique to our own writing, and sharing what we have written aloud with the class.
On our workshop days, you will work in groups, responding to one another’s drafts, which you will have mailed to the class beforehand.
Students will research a city/neighborhood of Taiwan and a working-class person who lives there.

grading.note: Four short writing assignments, which can be revised.
One long, reported story of 2000 words.
Class participation includes contributing to discussion, completing reading responses on time, and constructively critiquing peers’ work.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
